reviewText: I LOVED THIS MOVIE SO MUCH BECAUSE IT HAD TWO THINGS I LOVE IN A MOVIE; MURDER,AND SUSPENSE. THE MOVIE IS FULL OF IT. THIS FILM WILL KEEP YOU GUESSING, AND WONDERING WHO, AND WHY. THIS MOVIE IS ABOUT A YOUNG WOMAN WHO WAS FRAMED FOR HER LATE HUSBANDS DEATH. I DON'TWANT TO GIVE TO MUCH AWAY, BUT WHAT I WILL SAY IS YOU WILL BE IN CONSIDERABLE AWE WHEN YOU FIND OUT THER ACTUAL KILLER; YOU WON'T BELIEVE IT TRUST ME! OH AND ONE MORE THING SHE GETS A LITTLE HELP ALONG THE WAY TO CLEAR HER NAME.

reviewText: Molly Lasch (Brandy Ledford) has just been released from prison after serving a sentence for killing her husband. An old school friend and investigative reporter Fran Simmons (Laura Leighton) is sent by her editor to write a human interest story about Molly. Secretly, Fran does not believe Molly killed her husband and wants to investigate the story. She is reluctant to re-visit her home town however because her father was accused of embezzling half a million dollars from the library fund. Fran finds that Dr Gary Lasch (Steve Archer) is one of two doctors at the Lasch Institute who was murdered in the space of a few weeks. Lasch and the other doctor were both having an affair with Ann Marie Scalli (Ona Grauer). The head of the Lasch Institute now is Dr Peter Gaynes (Gedeon Burkhard) assisted by Nick Whitehall (Andrew Jackson) whose wife Jenna (Anne Openshaw) was also a schoolfriend of Fran's.As Fran investigates, it emerges that there is a lot more to the story than first appears. There is a young girl in a coma that seems to have been induced by medical negligence. Molly's housekeeper Edna Barry (Paula Shaw) has a retarded son who also was a friend of Molly's and frequent visitor to the house. It's a complicated story but it made for a very entertaining thriller: I won't reveal any of the other twists in the plot.
summary: An entertaining thriller based on Mary Higgins Clark's book

reviewText: Mary Higgins Clark is one of the world's most read suspense writers, and some made for TV movies of her books have surfaced.  WE'LL MEET AGAIN is an okay entry but it's cast isn't up to the material; most of them perform lethargically and don't compel us to feel for their characters.  Brandy Ledford plays a sexy young woman who is sentenced for the death of her doctor husband. She can't remember what went on the night of the murders.  Laura Leighton plays the plucky reporter whose roots go back to the town where this murder took place and she finds herself trying to help Ledford find out who murdered her husband.  Lots of red herrings and some confusing subplots give us several suspects, but with such listless direction and acting, the movie suffers and the viewer is left to muddle through the proceedings.

reviewText: I have a newly found liking for these Mary Higgins Clark mysteries ad this one is one of the very best I have seen to date.
summary: Nice tight murder and missing person mystery

reviewText: Paroled after having spent 6 years in prison for the murder of her husband, socialite Molly Lasch (Brandy Ledford) vows to prove her innocence and track down the real killer at any cost.With the help of her high school friend, investigative reporter Fran Simmons (Laura Leighton), Molly slowly begins to remember the events of that terrible night. But as they inch closer to uncovering the truth, Fran and Molly are drawn deeper into a web of lies, conspiracy, obsession and murder that could cost both women their lives.
